anamarias - (15:54): I'm not sure about something, and I would need an opinion on updating the state of a Dashboard  
anamarias - (15:55): The dashboard is a macro, and the gadgets on it are written in  the content of the dashboard macro.  
anamarias - (15:55): Any user that has admin or edit rights on a page with a dashboard on it can drag&drop the gadgets on the dashboard.  
anamarias - (15:55): I need to update the state of the dashboard, so I was thinking that after each drag&drop to make an AJAX request which would change the content of the dashboard macro.  
anamarias - (15:55): So an example, if I have the following dashboard:  
anamarias - (15:55): {{dashboard}}  
anamarias - (15:55): 1 {{gadget1/}}  
anamarias - (15:55): 2 {{gadget2/}}  
anamarias - (15:55): 3 {{gadget3/}}  
anamarias - (15:55): {{/dashboard}}  
anamarias - (15:55): (meaning I have 1 gadget on each column)  
anamarias - (15:55): If an editor takes the gadget on the 3rd column and places it on the fist column, the result will have to be:  
anamarias - (15:56): {{dashboard}}  
anamarias - (15:56): 1 {{gadget1/}}  
anamarias - (15:56): 1 {{gadget3/}}  
anamarias - (15:56): 2 {{gadget2/}}  
anamarias - (15:56): {{/dashboard}}  
anamarias - (15:56): My question is: having multiple editors on the same page at the same time, changing the state of the  dashboard macro content, won't it result in concurrency conflicts? How should I handle this update to be safe?  
sdumitriu - (15:56): Yes, it will  
sdumitriu - (15:56): Unfortunately we don't have locks  
sdumitriu - (15:56): The solution is to kindly ask people not to do this :)  
anamarias - (15:57): drag&drop stuff on a dashboard :P ?  
glerouge - (15:57): no, not to do it at the same time  
sdumitriu - (15:57): No, d&d in parallel  
anamarias - (15:57): another solution would be to only allow drag&drop like this in inline mode editing  
anamarias - (15:58): and throught the wysiwyg for macro dashboard  
anamarias - (15:58): and through wiki editor to change the text  
lucaa - (15:58): anamarias: well, from a usability pov I think you'd need to put the dashboard in a special state while dd on it  
sdumitriu - (15:58): Yes  
sdumitriu - (15:58): A button to start changing the dashboard  
lucaa - (15:58): for example, the way the panel editor works: you see the same thing, but it's a "special state" the design state  
lucaa - (15:59): and yes, it could be inline editing  
lucaa - (15:59): where you display the same thing, but allow dd  
anamarias - (15:59): how would this special state work, if there are no locks ?  
lucaa - (15:59): it can be inline editing  
lucaa - (15:59): which locks the doc (doesn't it, sdumitriu?)  
sdumitriu - (16:00): Yes  
anamarias - (16:00): ok, so d&d only in inline editing will solve it  
sdumitriu - (16:00): But it's a pessimistic lock, not a critica section
